meanings.definition: Shrewd or spirited initiative and resourcefulness.
meanings.sent1: She showed great gumption by starting her own business at a young age.
meanings.sent2: Using gumption, he found a creative solution to the problem.
meanings.sent3: With her gumption, she convinced the entire team to take on the challenging project.
meanings.sent4: His gumption was like a bright light guiding them through the darkest times.
meanings.sent5: The young inventor's gumption was truly inspiring to all who knew her.

meanings.sent1: It took a lot of gumption for him to admit his mistake and apologize.
meanings.sent2: With gumption, she carefully considered all options before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: His lack of gumption led to some questionable choices.
meanings.sent4: Her gumption was like a compass, always pointing her in the right direction.
meanings.sent5: Using gumption, he avoided unnecessary risks and made wise choices.

meanings.sent1: She showed incredible gumption by standing up to the bully.
meanings.sent2: With gumption, he faced his fears and conquered them.
meanings.sent3: His gumption in the face of danger was truly admirable.
meanings.sent4: The soldiers' gumption on the battlefield was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: With unwavering gumption, she tackled every challenge that came her way.
